definition: euthanasia
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
surname An
happy/cheerful/to laugh
music
surname Le
surname Yue
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

sentences.english: To euthanize unwanted pets has made his wife sick to her stomach.
sentences.chinese: 對不要的寵物進行安樂死，令他老婆很噁心。

sentences.english: The state medical examiner and chair ofanaesthesiology settled on a series of three drug injections.
sentences.chinese: 醫療審查者和麻醉學機構確定了安樂死的三個步驟。

sentences.english: Even so, any skunk captured in Illinois is euthanized.
sentences.chinese: 即使這樣，伊利諾伊州內捕獲的臭鼬均實施安樂死。

sentences.english: In a word, the legislation of mercy killing is suitable for gradualness .
sentences.chinese: 所以，安樂死立法宜循序漸進。

sentences.english: so he wanted to pretty much euthanize her.
and want to euthanize her, you know, kill.
sentences.chinese: 那時候，那個人想讓她安樂死。

sentences.english: Should voluntary euthanasia &physician-assisted suicide be legalized ?
It has also been used to euthanise animals.
sentences.chinese: 它也用於動物的安樂死。

sentences.english: Then the doctor could practice mercy-killing.
sentences.chinese: 那麼醫生們就可以安樂死。
那隻熊現在已被施行安樂死。

sentences.english: Euthanasia diverges apparently from intentional murder by committing a crime.
sentences.chinese: 安樂死在犯罪構成上與故意殺人有明顯的區別。

sentences.english: These are less living wills than examples of prestructured euthanasia.
sentences.chinese: 這些與其說是生前遺囑，不如說是提前安排的安樂死。

sentences.english: Some worry that legal euthanasia creates a slippery slope towards state-sponsored killing.
sentences.chinese: 有人擔心安樂死會漸漸變成國家主動的死亡。

sentences.english: It would be better to pull the plug on him than to keep his life in such a torture.
sentences.chinese: 與其讓他在這種折磨中敬且偷生，不如讓他安樂死去。

sentences.english: Decriminalization of euthanasia is actually equal to acknowledgement of people's right for death by law.
sentences.chinese: 安樂死合法化實際上就是法律對人的死亡權的認可。

sentences.english: Other states are going to consider making a similar law to deal with euthanasia.
sentences.chinese: 其他國家正在考慮制仃與安樂死類似的法律。

definition: to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
psychiatric hospital
to dismiss from office/to discharge/to sack
to pass (sth) on (to sb else)/to transfer sb (to another hospital etc)
reasonable self-defense/legitimate defense
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
reeducation through labor
to release for medical treatment (of a prisoner)
cerebral palsy
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
brain death
